page.title: 15WEATHER IN HASTINGS
page.content: Tourism, recreation, health and events are affected by the weather. Therefore the readings of the Borough Meteorologist are often referred to. Records have been kept for over 100 years. Winters are usually mild with mean monthly temperatures about 5 degrees centigrade. Snow settles for an average of 7 days but can cause chaos. Summers mean monthly temperatures in the shade are 17 degrees centigrade but the most suntraps often produce temperatures over 25 degrees centigrade. About 150 days a year have rain and the yearly total is about 750mm. Some summer days are spoilt by central fog. Every year there will be some days with strong gales.
